intro: Glochidion anamiticum, commonly known as the Anamiticum goosefoot, is a small evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
